intro: Myrsine niauensis, commonly known as the Cook Islands myrsine, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a glossy appearance. The flowers are small, white or pink, and are borne in clusters, attracting various pollinators.
